Comment: Hi all, and here is a game which I believe demonstrates the awesome power of rooks on the 7th rank. This is from Round 3 of the Intermediate 51st GK Tournament, and I open with my usual queen pawn.
!? Unusual move, but allows a direct transposition into the Pirc Defence, and possibly into a KID.

Another option is 3.f3, soon transposing directly into the Samisch KID. Since I prefer the Averbakh Variation of the KID, this transposition is no good to me, so I resolve to swallow my irritation at not being allowed 3.c4 and develop my queenside knight, allowing a main line Pirc position to form.

Another option is 3.f3, soon transposing directly into the Samisch KID. Since I prefer the Averbakh Variation of the KID, this transposition is no good to me, so I resolve to swallow my irritation at not being allowed 3.c4 and develop my queenside knight, allowing a main line Pirc position to form.

?! Unusual, as the knight can be kicked aroung with 4.d5.
Gaining a powerful pawn centre, with tempo. No wonder GameKnot's DB shows excellent statistics for White.

An opportunity to mess up Black's pawn structure seriously presents itself. The DB agrees.

(!) Ruining Black's pawn structure. Since the queens are off, Black's central pawn troubles are particularly bad for him, as it is easier for me to turn this into an endgame.

Not a good place for the bishop at all, seriously blocked in. What's wrong with 13...Bc5+, gaining a more active post with tempo?

Now both Black's bishops are banging their heads against granite. And, it's time for me to put the pressure on down that lovely open d-file.
Now both Black's bishops are banging their heads against granite. And, it's time for me to put the pressure on down that lovely open d-file.

There you go. White's pieces are textbook examples of active play. One rook on each open file, bishops have lovely diagonals to rake down. In contrast to Black's rooks, marooned on a8 and h8, and Black's bishop, biting on concrete. This, coupled with Black's awful pawn-structure, gives White a HUUUGGGEEE positional advantage - am I right?
This move gets a ? - it allows both my rooks to immediately dive into heaven on the 7th rank, hence the annotation title.
